channel.title: the_source (Video) - w/Aaron Newcomb
channel.description: Your source for open source, making and hacking
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.
channel.itunes:summary: the_source is a video podcast/IPTV show that discusses open source, making and hacking and includes news, events, reviews, demos and interviews. Hosted by Aaron Newcomb.
channel.itunes:subtitle: the_source is a video podcast/IPTV show that discusses open source, making and hacking and includes news, events, reviews, demos and interviews. Hosted by Aaron Newcomb.
channel.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

image.title: the_source - Your Source For Open Source, Making and Hacking

channel.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, making, hacking, podcast, podcasting

item.title: Episode 14 - "MakerFaire 2011" - July 06, 2011
item.description: Here is my MakerFaire 2011 episode. It's full of interviews with some of the biggest exhibitors as well as people who run the event itself. There are even a few special appearances by some movie and TV personalities you may recognize. If you didn't attend MakerFaire this year this is your chance to check it out. If you did attend why not re-live the excitement and learn about your favorite exhibits!
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, ubuntu, hacking, podcast, podcasting, makerfaire, arcattack, mythbusters
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 13 - "SCaLE 9X" - March 15, 2011
item.description: If you missed SCaLE 9X you won't want to miss this episode! Interviews with Leigh Honeywell (Hackerspaces), Jane Silber (Canonical), Orv Beach (SCaLE), Donald Burr (SCaLE), as well as, Lightning Interviews from the expo floor. Check out all the things you missed or relive the conference all over again.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, ubuntu, hacking, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 12 - "Mini" - November 09, 2010
item.description: This is a mini episode from East Bay Mini Maker Faire. I take a look at a couple of exhibits from this years rainy event in Oakland, CA. I talk to a few guys who went all out to build the ultimate gaming chair. Then I learn how to decorate eggs the geeky way.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, making, hacking, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 11 - "Open Source Around The House" - March 15, 2010
item.description: Join me on a tour of my house as I show how I use open source software in nearly every room. This episode also is the first to use my new intro. This episode is NOT sponsored by the Apple iPad.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 10 - "Ohio Linuxfest 2009" - October 21, 2009
item.description: Interviews from Ohio Linuxfest 2009: 40 Years of Unix. Richard Weait talks about Ontario Linuxfest and Open Street Maps, Greg Boehnlein gives an overview of this year's conference, Shawn Powers from Linux Journal talks about the economy of linux, Dave Yates talks about South East Linuxfest and Doug McIlroy talks about the history of Unix.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: osi, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting, olf, ohio linuxfest, shawn powers, doug mcilroy, unix
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 9 - "FISL10" - September 17, 2009
item.description: Highlights from FISL10 in Porto Alegre, Brazil including interviews with Chris DiBona and Michael Tiemann, using Open Source to make things out of computer junk, and President Lula da Silva speaks out on free software. Now in true 720p HD on Vimeo.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: osi, fisl, google, android, lula, robotics, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Special Source 6 - "Jon Maddog Hall" - March 17, 2009
item.description: Another interview from OLF. This time I talk with Jon "Maddog" Hall about his nickname, sustainable computing, and the Open Moko phone. Part 3 of 3 from Ohio Linuxfest 2008.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: olf, ohio linuxfest, jono bacon, ubuntu, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Special Source 5 - "OLF 08 Jono Bacon" - January 16, 2009
item.description: I interview Jono Bacon (Ubuntu Community Manager) about the demise of Lugradio, Ubuntu Intrepid Ibex and his musical pursuits. Part 2 of 3 from Ohio Linuxfest 2008. Part 2 of 3 from Ohio Linuxfest 2008.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: olf, ohio linuxfest, jono bacon, ubuntu, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Special Source 4 - "OLF 08 Elizabeth Garbee" - January 8, 2009
item.description: I interview Elizabeth Garbee on what it's like to be a teenager who uses Open Source. Part 1 of 3 from Ohio Linuxfest 2008.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: olf, ohio linuxfest, elizabeth garbee, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 8 - "xVM Ops Center" - November 8, 2008
item.description: On this episode I interview Oren Tiech from Sun Microsystems about xVM Ops Center. Also, you get to see me in my undies. Woo Hoo!
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: xvm, ops center, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 7 - "Virtualbox" - July 8, 2008
item.description: Intro from the car, Ubuntu Mikey, Virtualbox tutorial, outtakes.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: virtualbox, ubuntu, the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting

item.title: Episode 3 - "Revenge Of Cinelerra" - April 13, 2008
item.description: New show format, now in HD, Cinelerra Tutorial #4 Rendering and Transcoding, guy makes music with his hands.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting

item.title: Special Source 3 - "SUNday Bloody SUNday" - November 5, 2007
item.description: Aaron goes to a Sun Microsystems open source summit. Interviews with Simon Phipps, Alan Coopersmith (X.org), Ian Murdock (Project Indiana) and Glynn Foster (Gnome, et al).
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting

item.title: Special Source 2 - "The Ohio Linuxfest 2007" - October 10, 2007
item.description: Aaron goes to Ohio Linuxfest. Interviews with Jon "Maddog" Hall, Joe Born (CEO - Neuros) and Max Spevack (Fedora Project Manager).
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting

item.title: Episode 2 - "Attack Of The Elephants (Dream)" - June 8, 2007
item.description: It's been a long time, Where is Brian???, an interview with Bassam Kurdali of the Blender project, Elephants Dream, Cinelerra tutorial #3.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting, blender, cinelerra

item.title: Episode 1 - "The Filesystem Menace" - December 23, 2006
item.description: Merry Christmas from Aaron and Brian! Pirates??? Aaron has a new phone, Brian has a new car, an interview with Matt Ahrens and Mark Maybee from Sun about the revolutionary ZFS filesystem, Cinelerra tutorial #2, we still need your help!
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Special Source 1 - "The Ohio Linuxfest" - October 7, 2006
item.description: Aaron goes to Ohio Linuxfest. Interviews with Jeff Waugh, Joe Born (CEO - Neuros) and Ted Haeger (Novell Open Audio). Co-hosted by TLLTS.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 6 - "The Return Of The Pixel" - August 10, 2006
item.description: Aaron and Brian discuss server upgrades, the latest poll, Microsoft caves in, americas army, the movies (stunts and effects), an interview with Helmar Rudolph co-founder of QUNU, Cinelerra tutorial #1, your email, we need your help!
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, linux, technology, podcast, podcasting, qunu, cinelerra, video editing
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 5 - "The (Apple) Empire Strikes Back" - May 15, 2006
item.description: Brian talks about politics and open source, Aaron has a new job, DIVA, History of the iPod, iPodLinux, iDoom, Funny iPod commercials, Fedora Core 5, Beagle, F-Spot, and more ...
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, technology, podcast, podcasting, qemu
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Episode 4 - "QEMU" - March 3, 2006
item.description: Aaron and Ben discuss what the show is about, Google is starting to port some applications to Linux, Korea is developing an Open Spource City, Ben wants to try out Asterisk, and an in-depth review of QEMU.
item.author: thesourceshow@gmail.com (Aaron Newcomb)
item.itunes:keywords: the_source, open source, technology, podcast, podcasting, qemu
item.itunes:author: thesourceshow.org

item.title: Opening Sequence - January 25, 2006
item.description: Here is the opening sequence for the show. The screen is initially black for about 20 seconds to leave space for our intro. There will be a cross fade at the end into the news segment.
